column5: We typically go out to dinner with my father and step-mother.   Home for a little TV and bed.   Can't remember the last time I made it to midnight and still awake.  Loooong hours and days at work and I'm usually out by 10.   Today, taking down all the Christmas decorations.  Back to work tomorrow.  Prety exciting eh ?
Just chilled out at home with the girlfriend and the dogs.
Usually it's this for Maribeth and I...    But this New Years Eve a friend and his band is playing at the local Legion so we are partaking of the celebratioms there...  What are you doin' ???
The usual!
My lovely wife's grandparents are celebrating their 60th anniversary tonight...so we'll be partying with the family...then rolling out bright and early tomorrow morning for a day trip to Scugog
A dip in the hut tub, a BBQ and a movie....I know we are old and boring people. Maybe go for a walk New Years Day.
Hopefully the same! did you get an update on ice conditions?
THE KEG!!!!!! MMMMMMM STEAK!!
I've heard they're okay...got an update this morning from a guy I'm meeting up with out there.
Its been a wild holiday for us... business wont slow down.. and there been more than enough late nights and headachy mornings already... we've decided on a movie night and some snowshoeing today.
Watching the last show of a Canadian gem, The Royal Canadian Air Farce. I am going to miss that group.
Watch the Junior game, then hit the pit to get rested up for the holiday in Mexico. We leave bright & early tomorrow.  Happy New Year JF

a few coors lights and off to the fireworks with the kids at the city park then come home few more beers and ill be lucky to make it till midnight!  as usual..i just cant stay up late anymore....happy new year all.

gathering up the guys I jam with,packing the gear over to a buddy's place and being the band for the party along with that, my buddy's place we are going to he runs a karaoke business that he works at a few bars, so people will goof around with that in between us being the band.   And the kids can spend a couple hours goofing off and singing along with joining the grown-ups in some board games and cards.  Tonnes of different munchy foods everyone is making and bringing along too add to the festivities as well.    We generally try and make these sort of things a good time for the little kids, the teenagers and for us big kids too  A couple people are non-drinkers who are going so they agreed to be the DD's for the night, so that way everyone else who wants to over do it on the booze and stuff has a safe ride  home
Taking the kids to a movie in an hour Back home for dinner If winds die down a nice bon fire later and the junior game  Not too late a night, want to hit Simcoe or scugog tomorrow for a mid day bite

For me not much going on tonight but like BUSTER said a few Coors Light and will hit the sack early, want to be in tiptop shape to go fishing tomorrow early     Then in the afternoon, it's off to my parents and in laws for the traditional family blessing  ..... if we get back early.... might go fishing but not sure on that one  Leechman
vast amounts of alcohol consumption to the weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee hours of the new year.....( ill definatly be a write off tomorrow....) first aid kit is set up beside my bed
Hope you guys enjoyed it Norm...me, I worked am now on my way to bed so I can go back and do it all again tomorrow...  Maureen

Me, I just crawled into my nice warm bed and slept through it all. I feel great this morning, no hang over, no having to go looking for my car or keys, and no wondering who that is in bed beside me.  Good way to start the New Year off as far as I am concerned!  Happy 2009 to each and every one of you!

Wish I could say the same. My shift is ending in about 20 minutes. Then I'm going home to have breakfast with the family, get another half dozen flutter spoons painted and then crashing.  Happy New Year

we took the kids and a kids friend out for some bowling drinks and pizza and back home for the JR game for the wife and kids it was board games that was a shock as we just bought them a Wii for Christmas I dont understand so I just keep my mouth shut and was happy I could watch the game in HD and not lowD 20" LOL the funny part was I had the T.V. ready to switch over for Criminal minds that started at 12am well I can tell you bell has there time set to time square because the kids were doing the countdown and just as it hit 1sec left we were watching CM I just laughed my arse off the girls were confused and everyone but me thought I had the remote it was a great night none the less.  Happy New Year to all of ya here at OFC  Cheers Mike
....I had a quiet night around the fireplace with my GF and our collective group of four kids. Lots of food and plenty of noise at midnight. No hangover for me.  Happy New Year everyone.

I was here in Michigan at the inlaws place with a bad cold.  Slept on the couch from 7 til 10ish...fought to stay awake until midnight...took some cold medication and was asleep by 1215....LOL.  Earlier in the day, I noticed I had a flat tire....had to get that fixed...  Oh well...a new year has begun...and I hope it's the best ever!  Happy New year everyone!!!
Dang Cliff! Sorry to hear yer feelin' puny bubba!  I know that bly gal will take good care of ya though!!!  Happy New Year to you too!!!

Like ccmt, both Maribeth and I were fighting a cold all day long so by 10:00 PM our stay at the Legion was shortened...enjoyed what we heard of the band...and srangely, ended up at a table with two other couples from Alpine Village where we live...  By midnite it was back to the usual...    Getting too old I guess...OH well we gave it a shot...  Happy New Year !!!

The whole family (about 60 of us) got together on the farm. Everyone brought their Christmas trees for the bonfire. Had a whole bunch of skids and trees from thinning in the fall too. Made a huge fire. Lots of food and drinks for the kids and adults. Everyone brought a box of fireworks so we had a 40 min. show. All in all a great night.  Happy New Year to all.  Curt

this turned into getting to the party,waiting for a couple people to show up......then my wife decides to call and check on my little one...well the little one was throwing up and wanted to go home...so we had to leave the party just as it was getting started, pick up the little one, and go home and do nothing...I had a couple beers...wife fell alseep watching tv......yea..that was a fun party
